Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe and work with the Underwriting
Referral Reasons

Darren
Insurance
Product Manager

.

q
|

There are situations that require us to
put customer policies on hold. Does
PolicyCenter provide this capability?

| Policy holds G

¢ Are placed on a transaction in the event of a natural disaster or for changes in
business

¢ Are placed in a specific region for a period of time
« Allow a carrier to prevent users from:
* Creating new policies
* Changing existing policies
« Raise underwriting (UW) issues during a transaction
« When the effective date of the transaction falls in the date range of the policy hold, and
* The policy location matches the region affected by the policy hold

« Underwriting issues can be processed by an underwriter with proper underwriting authority

Sometimes | need to refer a policy to an
underwriter because there is not enough
information available in the system to make a
decision on a policy. Is there a way to do this in
PolicyCenter?

| Underwriting referral reasons Gi

¢ Used when a notable condition arises outside of a transaction, possibly outside of
the PolicyCenter maintained policy data

* Can be added manually or by external systems through an API
* Cannot be approved but can be removed from the policy

* Raises UW issues next time a transaction is run on that policy

Manual Nb
External .
System UW referral reason added UW issue raised

on bound policy on next policy transaction

| UW referral reasons and UW issues compared Gi

UW referral reason

Related to the policy — when something
notable about the policy needs to be brought
to the attention of underwriting the next time a
transaction runs

Generates a UWlssue which can stop
transactions progress

Often manually created, can only be deleted
manually or through an API, can’t be approved

Persists with the policy; resulting UWlssues
can be approved

Related to the transaction - when something
notable about this transaction needs to be
brought to the attention of underwriting

Can stop transaction progress that somebody
might approve when writing the policy

Often automatically generated, is usually
automatically removed when the cause no
longer exists

Can be approved; with approval, persists
along any descendent of the policy period

Question

_~ — Distinguish underwriting (UW) referral reasons from an UW issue.

Answer Gi

_~ — Distinguish underwriting (UW) referral reasons from an UW issue.

¢
¢
¢

The underwriting referral reason is specific to a policy. When it generates an
underwriting issue, the transaction will not progress further. UW referral reasons are
often manually created, cannot be approved, and are manually deleted (or through an
API). UW referral reasons persist with the policy.

Underwriting issues are related to the transaction. When something is notable about this
transaction requiring the attention of underwriting. They are often automatically generated,
and are usually automatically removed when the cause no longer exists.
